data.headline: DOWNASDAQS&P 500RUSSELL 2000DOW - Stock Price Chart
bullets: Nvidia and reports of an expanded Nvidia-Meta partnership sparked a strong rebound in tech, driving dip-buying in the Magnificent Seven stocks.
S&P 500 rose about 0.5%, Nasdaq gained 0.9%, Dow added 0.2%, and Russell 2000 climbed 0.5%.
Semiconductor and software sectors outperformed on easing AI selloff fears.
US economic data showed resilience in durable goods, core capex, manufacturing, and housing.
Fed January minutes revealed officials are divided and favor pausing rate cuts until inflation cools, tempering near-term rate cut expectations.
Markets shrugged off the hawkish Fed tone, supported by Treasury yields near multi-week lows and a firm dollar.

Garmin surged 16% on earnings, MSG Sports jumped 15% on Knicks/Rangers split exploration, with traders also watching moves in Analog Devices, Palantir, Synopsys, Cadence, Palo Alto Networks, Amazon, Apple, Wingstop, Global Payments, and Moderna.
Gold hovered near recent highs and global shares were broadly firmer as traders look ahead to Fridayâ€™s PCE data.
